intro: Alsine recurva var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular alsike clover, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, pink or purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in disturbed areas. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing characteristic of this variety.
